intro: Aylostera walteri, commonly known as the Walter's aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Aylostera walteri thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
